intro: Hebenstretia dura, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, with five petals and a prominent corona, and it blooms throughout the year under suitable conditions. Hebenstretia dura is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
